Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
(Medical R&D Sector – Confidential Client)




About the role




On behalf of one of our clients — a leading innovator in the medical research and development sector (Software and ML integrated Product)— we are recruiting for two open positions within the same dynamic R&D team:

Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Medior Machine Learning Engineer




This company is dedicated to improving healthcare outcomes through advanced statistical analysis and machine learning innovation. The ideal candidates will have a strong technical foundation, a passion for scientific research, and a deep interest in applying AI to solve meaningful real-world challenges in the healthcare domain.




Responsibilities

Research, design, and implement new machine learning models to enhance clinical data quality and support healthcare decision-making.
Continuously analyze scientific literature to identify promising algorithms and evaluate their practical application.
Produce robust, efficient Python code aligned with best software development practices.
Leverage open-source libraries and frameworks to drive experimentation and model optimization.
Apply best practices for experiment tracking, model validation, and deployment.
Explore new areas for machine learning applications in the medical and clinical research domain.
Actively contribute to scientific visibility through conferences, workshops, and potential publications.
Collaborate closely with data engineers, domain experts, and statisticians to bring prototypes into production.




Profile Sought

Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or other quantitative fields.
Solid professional experience in machine learning, data science, or applied AI roles.
Excellent command of Python.
Practical experience with at least one deep learning framework (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Comfortable with Git and collaborative development workflows.
Proven ability to translate theoretical research into operational AI solutions.
Language requirements: Fluent English is sufficient; no other languages are required




Nice to Have

Experience with deep learning and natural language processing (NLP).
Practical experience with deployment and monitoring of machine learning models.
Previous exposure to medical data or work in highly regulated industries (healthcare, life sciences, etc.).
Knowledge of GPU computing environments.




Offer

Two open roles: one Senior and one Medior Machine Learning Engineer.
Remote-first working model: nearly fully remote; only 1 day/week minimum presence on-site South Brussels
Opportunity to work on scientifically impactful projects with real-world healthcare applications.
Competitive salary package including bonuses, mobility benefits, healthcare insurance, and more.
Dynamic, multicultural team environment focused on research excellence, technical innovation, and personal development.
Access to powerful computing infrastructure, learning materials, and career growth opportunities.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
We are growing our Data Science team to help Tendam solve challenging problems from the retail fashion industry. We are now seeking a Data Scientist for a unique opportunity of impacting the way the world experiences fashion.

What you will do

Decompose complex data problems and conduct rigorous analysis and evaluations
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
Design, implement and maintain ETL processes to ensure data is available, reliable and ready for analysis and reporting.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
Present information using data visualization techniques (Quicksight)

What we are looking for

Scientific background with computational and analytical skills
Strong problem-solving skills
Programming skills with Python and SQL
Understanding and experience with big data systems, especially with Spark (PySpark)
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, regression, decision trees, neural networks, etc.)
Experience with data visualization tools and packages
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
>2 year of industry experience

Extra qualifications

Experience working with huge amounts of data
Experience with cloud-based web services (e.g., AWS)
Knowledge and experience with a version control system (e.g. Git).

Why Tendam

One of the largest customer data repositories in industry: more than 20M Club members
Working with multiple different data sources: purchases, marketing campaigns, products, web navigation, apps, etc.
Working with cutting edge technologies and building machine learning models to solve real world problems: have a real impact in the business!
Ability to immediately test the model results in real pilots: quick time to market!
Exposure to agile methodologies
Collaborating with a team of Data Scientists in an environment focused on learning, innovation, and professional development.
Working in a challenging and dynamic industry

What you will do

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - AI & Remote Sensing




Location: Espoo, Finland

Company: CollectiveCrunch




Join Us to Revolutionize Sustainable Forestry




CollectiveCrunch is reshaping the future of forestry through innovative, AI-powered analytics. Our mission is clear: deliver the most accurate, scalable, and timely forest analytics in the world. We’re looking for a talented Data Scientist to be part of our collaborative and innovative team based in Espoo, where you’ll have the opportunity to quickly develop your skills and make meaningful contributions from day one.




Your Impact




You’ll have direct ownership of critical AI models and data pipelines, working with diverse and exciting data sources such as LiDAR point clouds, satellite imagery, and aerial photography. Your creativity will directly shape our solutions, enhancing existing models and developing cutting-edge AI products for sustainable forest management.

In this role, you'll:




Take ownership of the full lifecycle of innovative machine learning models—from development to deployment.
Collaborate with internal teams and external partners to transform complex data into valuable insights.
Explore and apply new technologies and methodologies in remote sensing, geospatial analytics, and AI.
Create practical, scalable data products that impact real-world forestry operations.
Provide technical support and insights to our sales and product teams.

 

What You Bring




Essentials

Strong foundation in data science and machine learning techniques.
Proficiency in Python, with experience using machine learning frameworks.
Solid experience with SQL and data manipulation.

 

Preferred Experience

Familiarity with cloud services, DevOps, or MLOps practices.
Experience or interest in geospatial analytics or remote sensing (LiDAR, satellite imagery).
Background or enthusiasm for forestry, GIS, or environmental sciences.

 

Education & Experience

Master’s degree (or PhD) in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or related quantitative fields.
3+ years of professional experience as a Data Scientist.

 

Why You'll Love Working Here

Solve real-world problems that directly contribute to sustainable forestry.
Grow your career in an innovative and supportive environment where your ideas truly matter.
Become a key member of a close-knit team where your contributions really matter.

 

Show more
HTML:
Data Scientist - AI & Remote Sensing


Location: Espoo, Finland

Company: CollectiveCrunch


Join Us to Revolutionize Sustainable Forestry


CollectiveCrunch is reshaping the future of forestry through innovative, AI-powered analytics. Our mission is clear: deliver the most accurate, scalable, and timely forest analytics in the world. We’re looking for a talented Data Scientist to be part of our collaborative and innovative team based in Espoo, where you’ll have the opportunity to quickly develop your skills and make meaningful contributions from day one.


Your Impact


You’ll have direct ownership of critical AI models and data pipelines, working with diverse and exciting data sources such as LiDAR point clouds, satellite imagery, and aerial photography. Your creativity will directly shape our solutions, enhancing existing models and developing cutting-edge AI products for sustainable forest management.

In this role, you'll:


  • Take ownership of the full lifecycle of innovative machine learning models—from development to deployment.
  • Collaborate with internal teams and external partners to transform complex data into valuable insights.
  • Explore and apply new technologies and methodologies in remote sensing, geospatial analytics, and AI.
  • Create practical, scalable data products that impact real-world forestry operations.
  • Provide technical support and insights to our sales and product teams.

 

What You Bring


Essentials

  • Strong foundation in data science and machine learning techniques.
  • Proficiency in Python, with experience using machine learning frameworks.
  • Solid experience with SQL and data manipulation.

 

Preferred Experience

  • Familiarity with cloud services, DevOps, or MLOps practices.
  • Experience or interest in geospatial analytics or remote sensing (LiDAR, satellite imagery).
  • Background or enthusiasm for forestry, GIS, or environmental sciences.

 

Education & Experience

  • Master’s degree (or PhD) in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or related quantitative fields.
  • 3+ years of professional experience as a Data Scientist.

 

Why You'll Love Working Here

  • Solve real-world problems that directly contribute to sustainable forestry.
  • Grow your career in an innovative and supportive environment where your ideas truly matter.
  • Become a key member of a close-knit team where your contributions really matter.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🚀 Join Movify – Where elevation starts with a vision!




At Movify, we don’t just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of digital experiences?




About the job




🤠 What you'll be doing

Design and implement machine learning models to solve complex business problems
Develop data pipelines and workflows for large-scale data processing
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns and insights
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business challenges and define data science objectives
Create and maintain predictive models, optimization algorithms, and statistical analyses
Communicate findings and recommendations through compelling visualizations and reports
Stay current with advancements in machine learning and data science methodologies
Test, validate, and fine-tune models for accuracy and scalability
Work closely with data engineers to ensure data integrity and availability
Contribute to the development of the company’s data strategy and best practices




🤓 Skills & qualifications

3+ years of experience in a data science or related role
Proficiency in Python or R, with a strong understanding of data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large datasets
Solid understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and probability
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control systems (e.g., Git)
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
A proactive and innovative mindset with attention to detail
Fluent in French or Dutch with good command of English
A passion for turning data into actionable insights




😍 Movify offers

Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology and business
Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
Regular team-building activities and celebrations to keep the energy high

Title: Junior Data Scientist with English (Recent graduate)
Description:
Are you a recent graduate, passionate about challenges, and excited about working with cutting-edge technologies?




Are you motivated by transforming data into strategic knowledge and generating real impact?

Would you like to be part of a dynamic, international environment full of opportunities?




Our client, a fast-growing technology startup, is on a mission to accelerate the global success of mobile applications. Backed by a strong client portfolio of top-tier developers and publishers, the company operates from three strategic hubs: Spain, Poland, and the United States. As they continue to scale, they are now expanding their team in Barcelona and seeking motivated recent graduates eager to kick-start their careers and contribute to an ambitious, high-impact project.




Join a vibrant Data Tech-Hub where you can grow and learn from a passionate team of Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and ML/Data Engineers is ready to innovate and inspire!




Main Responsabilities:

Assist in analyzing data to identify trends, patterns, and contribute to actionable insights under the guidance of senior team members.
Participate in the design and development of data science solutions
Contribute to various stages from initial analysis and model development to deployment, with a focus on optimizing for performance and scalability within ad targeting, bid strategies, and campaign performance analysis.
Collaborate with technical and business teams to understand requirements and contribute to data-driven solutions and insights, particularly focusing on enhancing advertising effectiveness and ROI, while learning from experienced colleagues.
Assist in maintaining and optimizing existing data processing pipelines and machine learning models, with a focus on applications within the ad-tech ecosystem
Contribute to the exploration and evaluation of new data science techniques and technologies relevant to AdTech.




Core Skills/Experience:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to learn how to derive insights from datasets.
Solid understanding of statistical modeling and machine learning fundamentals.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.

Tech Stack (Exposure and Willingness to Learn):

Proficient in Python and SQL.
Familiarity with data manipulation frameworks such as Pandas.
Exposure to big data processing concepts (e.g., PySpark) is a plus.
Basic understanding of ETL processes and tools (e.g., concepts similar to Dagster).
Basic understanding of OLAP database concepts (e.g., concepts similar to Druid).
Familiarity with cloud services (e.g., AWS) at a conceptual level.
Exposure to DNN model training libraries and frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hydra, Comet) through coursework or projects.
Knowledge of Databricks (even through academic projects) is a plus.




What's on offer:

Competitive salary
Permanent Contract
Comprehensive benefits package
Opportunities for professional development and growth
Flexible work hours and vacation policy
Great opportunity to kick-start your career in Data Science




Our recruitment process:

Step 1: Interview with our Recruiter to get to know you
Step 2: Interview with our client's HR Team
Step 3: Technical interview
Step 4: Interview with Hiring Manager

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Our client offers AI-powered SaaS solutions to optimize electricity sales and efficiently manage renewable portfolios. Their innovative software empowers green energy players to automate power trading decisions, enabling them to become active market participants and maximize returns while managing risk efficiently.

The company has been founded on the belief that a green energy economy can be both sustainable and competitive and they are driven to make a change in the sector by accelerating technology.

They are active across Europe and is partnering with Europe’s leading energy service companies, independent renewable energy producers and large industries, among others.

Recently they closed their latest investment round with Encavis AG, one of the leading independent power producers (IPP), listed on the MDAX of Deutsche Börse AG. That strategic investment will open new opportunities for them by giving an exposure to pan-European platforms, industry expertise and access to new markets.

They are currently scaling their research and development team specializing in developing innovative solutions to complex problems using cutting-edge technology and advanced scientific knowledge.

Your Role and Responsibilities:

They are looking for an ambitious Data Scientist who is passionate about building data-driven products intended to support integration of renewable energy.

You will be responsible for improving advanced data science and machine learning solutions to optimize trading of renewable energy on various markets.




Develop and implement advanced machine learning models and algorithms, including XGBoost, CatBoost, LightGBM, and deep neural networks, specifically for tabular data
Analyze complex datasets to identify patterns, trends, and insights
Collaborate with product, engineering, and business teams to understand objectives and deliver data-driven solutions
Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in data science and machine learning, especially techniques related to tabular data
Contribute to the development and optimization of our data processing and modeling pipelines




​What would make you a strong fit:

Relevant experience working on data science projects
Familiarity in programming languages such as Python
Competence in supervised and unsupervised learning techniques for tabular data
Experience with advanced algorithms like XGBoost, CatBoost, LightGBM, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and deep neural networks
Understanding of model evaluation, validation, and optimization techniques
Experience deploying machine learning models on cloud platforms and familiarity with cloud-based services for data processing and model deployment such as AWS will be considered as an advantage
Step beyond traditional roles to lead initiatives and introduce improvements
Experience working in team environment
Excellent communication skills in English, both verbal and in writing

​

For more details, let's talk at martin@cadabra.bg

(License No. 2709 from 17.01.2019)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist , Leusden




Natuurlijk is Data Science een essentieel onderdeel van onze Digital Transformation doelstellingen.

En die zijn ambitieus. Want om de nummer 1 te blijven in de Do It Yourself-markt, moeten we data slim inzetten om innovatief en efficiënt te blijven.

Onze organisatie groeit, en met de toenemende focus op data-gedreven werken, zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Data Scientist die ons gedreven team komt versterken. Heb jij de technische expertise, strategisch inzicht en leiderschapskwaliteiten om data science binnen Intergamma naar het volgende niveau te brengen? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!




Over de functie:

De afgelopen twee jaar hebben we als team al mooie stappen gezet in de richting van data-driven innovatie. We hebben de eerste producten opgeleverd en geanalyseerd. Nu staan we als team klaar om deze successen verder te optimaliseren en door te ontwikkelen. Als Data Scientist werk je aan het bouwen en optimaliseren van machine learning-modellen en datapipelines die direct bijdragen aan deze doelen. Je speelt een sleutelrol in het realiseren van de roadmap, met de focus op het vertalen van data naar concrete inzichten die onze bedrijfsdoelen ondersteunen.




Je bent onder meer verantwoordelijk voor:

Het vergelijken van prestaties van verschillende bouwmarkten om best practices te identificeren en processen te verbeteren.
Het analyseren van klantdata en productcombinaties om datagestuurde beslissingen te nemen die de klantbeleving verbeteren.
Het ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen voor klantwaarde om klanttevredenheid en -loyaliteit te verhogen.
Het ontwikkelen en implementeren van geavanceerde machine learning-modellen en deep learning-oplossingen die bijdragen aan de bedrijfsdoelstellingen.
Het bouwen en optimaliseren van complexe datapipelines en -architecturen.
Het vertalen van complexe business vraagstukken naar creatieve data science-oplossingen.
Het leiden van uitdagende projecten zoals het ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen voor voorraadbeheer, het optimaliseren van prijsstrategieën, en het personaliseren van klantreizen door middel van machine learning.
Het motiveren en coachen van ons data science-team en het bieden van mentorship aan junior teamleden.
Het zichtbaar maken van data science binnen en buiten de organisatie door deel te nemen aan communities, het geven van presentaties, en het delen van kennis over markttrends.
Nauw samenwerken met teams zoals Marketing, Supply Chain en IT om cross-functionele data-oplossingen te ontwikkelen die onze bedrijfsprocessen optimaliseren.




Wat breng je mee:

Technische vaardigheden:
Diepe kennis van machine learning-algoritmen, deep learning, en geavanceerde data-analysetechnieken.
Ervaring met cloudplatforms zoals AWS, Azure, of GCP.
Beheersing van programmeertalen zoals Python, R, en SQL.
Ervaring met MLOps-tools en frameworks zoals TensorFlow, PyTorch of MLflow is een sterke pré.
Ervaring met relevante tools als Dataiku of Databricks
Business vaardigheden:
Uitstekende communicatievaardigheden in het Nederlands, om complexe analyses helder over te brengen aan diverse stakeholders.
Ervaring in het ontwikkelen van data-oplossingen die direct bijdragen aan bedrijfsresultaten.
Leiderschapskwaliteiten:
Vermogen om een team te inspireren, motiveren en naar een hoger niveau te tillen.
Ervaring met het beheren van data science-projecten en stakeholdermanagement.




Wat wij bieden:

Een bruto fulltime maandsalaris van € 3.800,- tot € 6.000,- (Intergamma betaalt per periode van 4 weken), inschaling is afhankelijk van ervaring.
Telefoon en laptop van de zaak, een goede pensioenregeling, en 32 vakantiedagen.
Flexibele werktijden en de mogelijkheid om deels thuis te werken.
Een dynamische werkomgeving bij een marktleider die ontwikkeling, werkplezier en welzijn centraal stelt.
Ruime mogelijkheden voor innovatie, diversiteit en persoonlijke groei.
Een unieke kans om impact te maken in een groeiende en innovatieve organisatie.




Achter elke klus vind je Intergamma:

Intergamma is dé organisatie achter de doe-het-zelf-formules GAMMA en Karwei. Met bijna 160 eigen bouwmarkten in Nederland en België zijn we al jaren de onbetwiste nummer één duurzame retailer op de doe-het-zelfmarkt. In Europa horen we bij de 15 grootsten. En daar zijn we trots op!

Vanuit ons hoofdkantoor in Leusden werken we met bijna 400 betrokken medewerkers samen om onze goede naam als omnichannel doe-het-zelf retailer hoog te houden. Dat doen we door volop te blijven investeren in verbeteringen en strategische initiatieven die ons verder de toekomst in helpen om gezond en winstgevend te blijven.




Sla nu de spijker op z’n kop!

Eerst nog vragen? Bel dan met Kido Otten op 06 83455440. Gelijk solliciteren kan ook via bijgaande sollicitatieknop.

Show more

Title: DATA SCIENTIST COE COMPLIANCE
Description:
¿Te entusiasma hacer crecer tu carrera?

BBVA es una compañía global con más de 160 años de historia que opera en más de 25 países donde damos servicio a más de 80 millones de clientes. Somos más de 121.000 profesionales trabajando en equipos multidisciplinares con perfiles tan diversos como financieros, expertos legales, científicos de datos, desarrolladores, ingenieros y diseñadores.

Conoce más sobre el área:

Cumplimiento, como parte del modelo de Control Interno persigue desde su rol de segunda línea de defensa, contribuir de manera activa al desarrollo de la estrategia y propósito de BBVA, generando impacto y aportando valor en toda la organización. Por ello venimos evolucionando hacia un Enfoque y una Gestión Preventiva del riesgo de Cumplimiento y Conducta que soportado en una robusta infraestructura tecnológica y de datos refuerce la Cultura de Cumplimiento en BBVA y dé respuesta al exigente entorno regulatorio y social. El Marco de Cumplimiento contribuye a desarrollar el propósito y estrategia del Grupo desde un rol de acompañamiento y supervisión (challenge) al Negocio en sus planes de crecimiento para que este sea sostenible y esté fundamentado en una gestión responsable de nuestros riesgos Tradicionalmente el enfoque de los desarrollos tecnológicos en Cumplimiento ha sido “regulatorio” y con foco en los programas de Prevención de Blanqueo de Capitales y Abuso de Mercado. Sin descuidar esa óptica, y en línea con la evolución de la función, seguimos trabajando en adecuar la infraestructura tecnológica al plan estratégico del negocio, cubriendo áreas como la prevención de los conflictos de intereses, conducta con los clientes, protección de datos, competencia, etc.

Cumplimiento Normativo es una de las áreas con mayor recorrido para la aplicación de técnicas de Ciencia de Datos y así lo recogen los principales players del mercado.

Dentro del área de Compliance Advanced Analytics participarás en la definición y ejecución end-to-end de proyectos innovadores de analítica avanzada en el entorno corporativo (Datio).

Aplicarás técnicas y metodologías de Big Data en un equipo con alcance global y participarás de forma activa en una Comunidad de Expertise de Data (COE) global y en una CoP de Data global, compartiendo experiencias y mejores prácticas con compañeros de otras geografías.

Nuestra ambición es intervenir de forma activa en la mejora y transformación de los procesos más relevantes de Compliance, basándonos en datos y desarrollando algoritmos que utilizan técnicas de IA y Machine Learning.

Sobre el puesto

Dentro de la Función de Cumplimiento Global, buscamos una persona que se incorpore al equipo Compliance Advanced Analytics en Madrid. Reportando jerárquicamente al responsable de dicho equipo, tu misión principal será, la ejecución de proyectos de Ciencia de Datos, participando en los scrum Agile como Data Scientist.

Participarás activamente en una COE global, compartiendo experiencias y mejores prácticas con los compañeros de otras geografías y en la CoP global de Data.

Velarás por que los modelos desarrollados sean medidos de forma correcta y que se ajusten a los requisitos de la norma de Model Governance Framework.

Buscamos una persona dinámica, apasionada por los datos y con las siguientes habilidades:


Experiencia (1-3 años) con Ciencia de Datos y con sólidos conocimientos en la materia
Capacidad de trabajo en equipo y dotes de comunicación
Capacidad de análisis y de síntesis.
Responsable y conocedor de los riesgos a considerar y mitigar en los modelos de Ciencia de Datos


Cualificaciones:


Título Universitario: Licenciatura en Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística u otras similares y Máster o formación específica en Ciencia de Datos
Experiencia en aplicación de técnicas de IA y Machine Learning en casos reales
Amplio conocimiento en Data Analytics y dominio de herramientas de software de programación (R, Python, Spark, Hadoop, …) y sistemas de análisis de datos masivos (Big Data, Machine Learning)
Experiencia con herramientas de Reporting (Microstrategy, Tableau…)
Experiencia en diseño e implementación de pipelines de procesamiento de datos en entornos EMR y GIS.
Validación, versionado y despliegue de modelos utilizando pipelines y buenas prácticas (linting, testing...).
Conocimiento en el uso de variables de entorno (application.conf) y estructuras de scaffolder.
Conocimientos de SQLAlchemy, PostgreSQL y manejo de particiones y formatos como Parquet.
Gestión de ingestion jobs mediante ADA Console y configuración de recursos computacionales adecuados (clústers, tallas, paths)
Capacidad de comunicación efectiva con equipos de negocio, siendo capaz de traducir el lenguaje técnico en insights de valor que faciliten la toma de decisiones basadas en datos.


Se valorará positivamente:


Experiencia previa en el entorno ADA de BBVA
Conocimiento de la infraestructura, procesos y datos de BBVA
Conocimientos de técnicas de grafos
Nivel de inglés mínimo tanto escrito como hablado: B2 (deseable C1).


Habilidades:

Bitbucket, Clústeres de datos, Comunicación, Estadística, Matemáticas, Microsoft Excel, Python para análisis de datos, Regresiones lineales, Toma de decisiones, Trabajo en equipo
Show more
HTML:
¿Te entusiasma hacer crecer tu carrera?

BBVA es una compañía global con más de 160 años de historia que opera en más de 25 países donde damos servicio a más de 80 millones de clientes. Somos más de 121.000 profesionales trabajando en equipos multidisciplinares con perfiles tan diversos como financieros, expertos legales, científicos de datos, desarrolladores, ingenieros y diseñadores.

Conoce más sobre el área:

Cumplimiento, como parte del modelo de Control Interno persigue desde su rol de segunda línea de defensa, contribuir de manera activa al desarrollo de la estrategia y propósito de BBVA, generando impacto y aportando valor en toda la organización. Por ello venimos evolucionando hacia un Enfoque y una Gestión Preventiva del riesgo de Cumplimiento y Conducta que soportado en una robusta infraestructura tecnológica y de datos refuerce la Cultura de Cumplimiento en BBVA y dé respuesta al exigente entorno regulatorio y social. El Marco de Cumplimiento contribuye a desarrollar el propósito y estrategia del Grupo desde un rol de acompañamiento y supervisión (challenge) al Negocio en sus planes de crecimiento para que este sea sostenible y esté fundamentado en una gestión responsable de nuestros riesgos Tradicionalmente el enfoque de los desarrollos tecnológicos en Cumplimiento ha sido “regulatorio” y con foco en los programas de Prevención de Blanqueo de Capitales y Abuso de Mercado. Sin descuidar esa óptica, y en línea con la evolución de la función, seguimos trabajando en adecuar la infraestructura tecnológica al plan estratégico del negocio, cubriendo áreas como la prevención de los conflictos de intereses, conducta con los clientes, protección de datos, competencia, etc.

Cumplimiento Normativo es una de las áreas con mayor recorrido para la aplicación de técnicas de Ciencia de Datos y así lo recogen los principales players del mercado.

Buscamos una persona dinámica, apasionada por los datos y con las siguientes habilidades:

  • Experiencia (1-3 años) con Ciencia de Datos y con sólidos conocimientos en la materia
  • Capacidad de trabajo en equipo y dotes de comunicación
  • Capacidad de análisis y de síntesis.
  • Responsable y conocedor de los riesgos a considerar y mitigar en los modelos de Ciencia de Datos

Cualificaciones:

  • Título Universitario: Licenciatura en Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística u otras similares y Máster o formación específica en Ciencia de Datos
  • Experiencia en aplicación de técnicas de IA y Machine Learning en casos reales
  • Amplio conocimiento en Data Analytics y dominio de herramientas de software de programación (R, Python, Spark, Hadoop, …) y sistemas de análisis de datos masivos (Big Data, Machine Learning)
  • Experiencia con herramientas de Reporting (Microstrategy, Tableau…)
  • Experiencia en diseño e implementación de pipelines de procesamiento de datos en entornos EMR y GIS.
  • Validación, versionado y despliegue de modelos utilizando pipelines y buenas prácticas (linting, testing...).
  • Conocimiento en el uso de variables de entorno (application.conf) y estructuras de scaffolder.
  • Conocimientos de SQLAlchemy, PostgreSQL y manejo de particiones y formatos como Parquet.
  • Gestión de ingestion jobs mediante ADA Console y configuración de recursos computacionales adecuados (clústers, tallas, paths)
  • Capacidad de comunicación efectiva con equipos de negocio, siendo capaz de traducir el lenguaje técnico en insights de valor que faciliten la toma de decisiones basadas en datos.

Se valorará positivamente:

  • Experiencia previa en el entorno ADA de BBVA
  • Conocimiento de la infraestructura, procesos y datos de BBVA
  • Conocimientos de técnicas de grafos
  • Nivel de inglés mínimo tanto escrito como hablado: B2 (deseable C1).

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you a motivated Data Scientist, willing to grow as a professional and work on large-scale projects, using different working approaches that are both diverse and cutting-edge? Are you passionate about innovative and top-notch software solutions and want to be part of like-minded professionals? Do you enjoy working in a fast-paced, yet collaborative environment?




If your answer is “Yes”, we would love to talk to you.




What your responsibilities are going to be?




Apply large language models (LLMs) to specific business problems to extract, process, classify and derive insights from the information hidden in unstructured datasets.
Develop domain- or task-specific language models for business problems when proprietary or off-the-shelf models cannot be used.
Evaluate the performance of machine learning models and make recommendations for improvement.
Research and experiment with key technologies to remain up to date with the state of the art in NLP and generative AI research.
Generate clean, efficient, and documented Python code.
Offer direction and expertise to junior team members, promoting a culture of learning and knowledge sharing.
Actively participate in code reviews and contribute to the establishment of software development best practices.
Assist in data projects assessment, discovery, and design phases




What qualifications are needed?




3+ years of experience as Data Scientist and hands-on experience with large language models (GPT, XLNet, T5, etc.).
Advanced skills in Python development including libraries like NumPy, SciPy and experience with SQL.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Practical experience in working with cloud platforms, MS Azure, AWS or Google Cloud.

Advantage

PhD or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, Theoretical Linguistics or a related field. Relevant working experience may compensate for lack of education.
Experience with containerization, Kubernetes (K8S) and application deployment.
Knowledge or experience with vector databases such as Pinecone, Milvus, or Weaviate would be beneficial




By joining us:




• You will have the chance to bring your technical expertise, enthusiasm, and entrepreneurial mindset, and shape the way we transform the business (and lives) of our clients, partners and society.

• You will be surrounded by other highly performing team members and will have the chance to grow and scale with us.

• You will become part of a thrilling and collaborative environment where you will be able to share your ideas and gain insightful feedback.

• You will enjoy flexibility and be able to keep the balance between your personal and professional life and focus on what’s important.




All applications will be treated in strict confidentiality.




We believe that different perspectives drive meaningful change and help us build cutting-edge technology solutions. Our commitment to inclusion ensures that every individual—regardless of background, identity, or personal characteristics—feels valued, respected, and empowered. As an equal opportunity employer, we base hiring decisions on experience, skills, qualifications, and potential.




By applying for this job, you agree with our Privacy Policy | Scalefocus.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Ampliamos nuestro equipo y nos gustaría contar contigo para formar parte de un proyecto en el que estamos trabajando integrados en cliente. Llevamos la innovación y la excelencia tecnológica en nuestro ADN, y trabajamos con actitud positiva y con pasión para alcanzar nuestro objetivo: ayudar a nuestros clientes en su proceso de transformación.

¿Quieres formar parte del #TeamPanel?

¿Eres apasionado por los datos y quieres formar parte de un equipo innovador? ¡Esta es tu oportunidad! Estamos en búsqueda de un Junior Data Scientist para unirse a nuestro equipo en Barcelona, con disponibilidad para trabajar presencialmente 3 días en Viladecans.

¿Qué vamos a mirar en tu perfil?

Formación en Grado o Máster en Data Science, Estadística, Ingeniería o campo relacionado.

Mínimo 2 años de experiencia en análisis de datos y ciencia de datos.

Sólido conocimiento en Python y librerías como Pandas, Scikit-learn.

Experiencia en análisis estadístico, preprocesamiento de datos y desarrollo de modelos de machine learning.

Habilidades de comunicación y trabajo en equipo.

Nivel de inglés B2 o superior.

Se Valorará

Conocimientos en técnicas de optimización metaheurística (Genetic Algorithms, Particle Swarm Optimization).

Experiencia en procesamiento de lenguaje natural (text classification, embeddings).

Familiaridad con herramientas de visualización (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly).

Conocimientos básicos de SQL y procesos ETL.

Experiencia con control de versiones (Git).

Conocimientos en plataformas cloud como AWS o Azure.

Tu MISIÓN

Analizar y preprocesar grandes volúmenes de datos para extraer información valiosa.

Desarrollar, entrenar y evaluar modelos de machine learning para resolver diferentes desafíos del negocio.

Colaborar con el equipo en la definición de soluciones basadas en datos, aportando ideas y mejoras.

Implementar algoritmos de optimización metaheurística, como algoritmos genéticos o PSO, para mejorar los modelos y procesos.

Trabajar con procesamiento de lenguaje natural para analizar textos y extraer insights relevantes.

Crear visualizaciones de datos claras y efectivas para comunicar resultados a diferentes equipos.

Participar en tareas de integración y automatización de procesos mediante SQL, ETL y control de versiones.

Contribuir en proyectos en la nube, utilizando plataformas como AWS o Azure, para desplegar y gestionar modelos y soluciones.

Lugar De Trabajo

Barcelona (presencial 3 días en Viladecans).

¿A qué nos comprometemos?

Impulsaremos tu Talento con un Plan de Desarrollo Profesional y Programas de Tutoría individualizada.

Completo Programa de formación que incluye desde programas de especialización técnica hasta idiomas, habilidades en gestión de proyectos, metodologías ágiles y certificaciones. Tanto on-line como presencial.

Políticas de conciliación como el Teletrabajo en modo full-remote jornada continua los viernes y en verano, flexibilidad horaria, días de permiso en navidad, y facilidades para la movilidad geográfica de los empleados.

Beneficios sociales como retribución flexible, complemento al 100 de bajas médicas, condiciones especiales en seguro médico privado o Tarjeta VISA empleados.

Nuestra empresa es hoy referencia en entorno Cloud, participando en varios proyectos de investigación a nivel europeo, y con muchos más proyectos sobre los que podrás diseñar una trayectoria profesional a largo plazo. Aplica y nos conoceremos

Python, Pandas, Scikit learn, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly, SQL, ETL, Git, AWS, Azure
Show more

Beneficios sociales como retribución flexible, complemento al 100 de bajas médicas, condiciones especiales en seguro médico privado o Tarjeta VISA empleados.

Nuestra empresa es hoy referencia en entorno Cloud, participando en varios proyectos de investigación a nivel europeo, y con muchos más proyectos sobre los que podrás diseñar una trayectoria profesional a largo plazo. Aplica y nos conoceremos

Python, Pandas, Scikit learn, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly, SQL, ETL, Git, AWS, Azure

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.


Neotalent, the responsive people.


Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.


Role Overview:

We are looking a Machine Learning Engineer to integrate one of our biggest clients in the banking sector. The client in question is one of the biggest banks in europe, with activity in over 70 countries around the world, it also counts with over 150 years of existence which means that is an extremely consolidated player in the banking industry (Lisbon- Hybrid).


You will integrate a Data & Digital Hub which integrates other activities linked to Data Management, Data Protection and Digital Innovation. It makes this department a real end to end center of expertise on data, innovation and technology.


What you will do:

  • Collaborate with clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs in terms of complex AI/ML challenges;
  • Investigate and solve business issues using technical, data-driven, AI/ML strategies;
  • Build and/or adapt AI/ML models: Design and develop Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions, i.e., collect labeled data, setup and train models, test and evaluate results;
  • Work closely with clients during application roll-out and all stages of the application lifecycle;
  • Design the most adequate approaches to solve the identified problems within the company’s framework;
  • Implement and assist the deployment and maintenance of models: Follow to best practices in the industry to implement and scale out the developed solutions into production grade software and Assist the operational teams with the deployment, monitoring and maintenance of the developed solutions.


What you are like:

  • At least, 2 years of experience as a Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer or similar;
  • Knowledge of Machine Learning models;
  • Knowledge of NLP and/or computer vision techniques;
  • Knowledge of deep learning architectures and frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, Keras, …);
  • Knowledge of at least one ML development stack (e.g. Scikit-learn, Keras, PyTorch…);
  • Knowledge of ETL methods;
  • Effective Programming skills (e.g. Python) and algorithmic knowledge;
  • Fluency in written and spoken English;


Why join us:

  • Work on challenging projects for big clients
  • Learn more about emerging technologies
  • Design your career plan
  • Access to continuous training and certifications
  • Evolve through our internal mobility program
  • … and much more!

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
[In order to requisition 1968]

Join Our Generative AI Technical Group at Tweag the OSPO of Modus Create!

We are looking for an AI Engineer to join our Generative AI technical group, where we combine engineering agility with deep expertise and a scientific approach to advance the state of how AI is used, provide actionable practical insights, and establish best practices in the field.

About You

Previously, you worked as an AI engineer, data engineer or software developer, with a couple of AI or data-centric projects under the hood. Perhaps you have been relying on previous academic experience in a quantitative field for autonomous, deep-dive work for that, but no matter how, you absorb quickly and enthusiastically. Since The Hype started, you have successfully designed and implemented applications using Generative AI.

Now that you know how to build stuff, you realized that there are wrong turns commonly taken in the community, whether imposed by tooling or by culture. As an engineer, you want to make the AI world a better place for not only developers, but also maintainers, product owners, and end users.

If you recognize yourself in parts of the above, the Generative AI group at Tweag, the OSPO of Modus Create, wants you to help us advance the way how AI technologies are used in the field. By building well-written open source tools and libraries, freely and happily sharing knowledge internally, on our technical blog, and during conferences, and consulting clients on how to build better with AI, you and the whole team can make a real difference: let's look behind all the buzz and make sure things are done right™!

Technologies and Tools


Python programming language and its popular numeric and data frameworks
Familiarity with an LLM framework (e.g. LangChain) and evaluation libraries
Cloud AI services: experience with some of SageMaker, Bedrock, Rekognition, etc. or equivalents on other platforms
Data storage and querying: SQL and NoSQL databases


Bonus points for


Comfortable with Git, GitHub/GitLab and CI/CD
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Experience with other languages like Java, Scala, Rust, or R
Knowledge of cloud architecture, DevOps, or front-end development
Experience with processing / orchestration tools such as Airflow, Spark, Kafka, Nextflow, etc.
Contributions to open source projects
Academic background


Team Culture:

At Modus, a fast-growing, remote-first company, you'll experience various exciting projects! Here's a taste of what you might do:


Giving back: Be an active participant through opportunities such as blog posts, open source contributions, and event speaking.
Travel & connections: Meet fantastic people during our remote meet-ups! It's all about collaboration and fun! Global environment and diversity at its best.
Teaching and learning: Work in active teams on internal and external projects, staying up-to-date with the latest technologies.
Being a self starter: Autonomy and proactivity are the key to succeed at Modus.
Client interaction: Represent Modus and our values while connecting directly with our clients, some of the world's biggest brands.
Growth: Enjoy comprehensive learning benefits, with access to over 12,000 courses. Your growth is our priority!


About us:

Founded in 2011, Modus is a global, fully remote team of world-class technologists who thrive in a collaborative, innovative environment. We were fully remote before it was cool! We support organizations on their digital transformation journey through strategic consulting and full lifecycle product development, partnering with industry leaders including Atlassian, GitHub and AWS. Recognized as one of the Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing Private Companies for nine years and a top remote work company by FlexJobs, we have helped some of the world's largest brands deliver powerful digital experiences.

We combine boutique expertise with enterprise-scale capabilities. As an award-winning Atlassian partner with a world-class team, we help organizations innovate and solve complex challenges for Fortune 500 companies and beyond, we want to hear from you.

Perks of working with us:


Remote work with flexible working hours
Modus Global Office Programme:for when you want to get out of your home, we offer on-demand access to private offices, meeting rooms, coworking spaces and business lounges in locations in over 120 countries.
Employee Referral Program
Client Referral Program
Travel according to client or team needs
The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech
Access to more than 12,000 courses with a licensed Coursera account.
Possibility to obtain paid certification/courses if they align with company goals and are relevant to the employee's role


By joining our team, you'll be part of a winning squad that plays to each other's strengths and celebrates every success together. Apply now and show us you've got what it takes to take your consulting skills to the next level with Modus Create!

Title: EU Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: EU Data Scientist

Location: Hybrid, Lisbon

Competitive salary and benefits




Join one of Europe's largest B2B used vehicle service




At BCA, we’re altogether, more. More than just your average vehicle remarketing company. More than just any other place to work. We’re Europe's largest vehicle remarketing business, the backbone of the automotive supply chain.




The BCA EU business is now at an exciting turning point in their ambitions for how data can enhance their customer proposition. This role is part of a significant investment in strengthen the Decision Intelligence capability in the EU business, through a continuous development and maintenance of the Data Warehouse, expanding our use of Data Science & Machine learning solutions, developing new dashboards and fostering the adoption of these tools by the business users, promoting efficiencies and generating added value.




As a Data Scientist working for BCA, you’ll be responsible for the development, maintenance and improvement of our machine learning data products in the EU using our best-in-class framework. Furthermore, from starting with simple proofs of concept through to model refinement and deployment you’ll be involved in the development of new data products for the EU business.

The ideal candidate will have experience of statistical learning approaches e.g regression, tree-based approaches, time-series methods, clustering, etc, and will be innovative in model development and naturally curious, willing to try new approaches.




Solutions will be built using BCA’s best of breed Data Science solution (Python, SQL Server, Git, Databricks, MLflow, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Data Lake, Azure DevOps Services and Azure Kubernetes Services).







Role Accountabilities:




Ensure the on-going accuracy of BCA’s valuation models through the development of predictive models and machine learning approaches, experimenting with new ideas to further enhance our BCA Valuation product-set.
Utilise models to provide pricing intelligence to key stakeholders ensuring the direction of the market in each country is understood.
Explain the implications of models and model insights to business stakeholders and external customers in an easy-to-understand way.
Be able to identify and suggest new opportunities where the Data Science Team can add value to the BCA EU business.




Knowledge and Experience:




Experience of using a statistical language to build data products, preferably Python or R.
An added advantage is experience with a well-rounded stack of data science libraries, such as NumPy, Scikit-learn, Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, Statsmodels, and XGBoost, to effectively clean, preprocess, transform, model, and visualize datasets.
Experience in object-oriented programming and package building is valued.
Knowledge of a machine learning approaches to model data (supervised/unsupervised analysis). E.g. Logistic regression, general linear models, decision trees, deep learning, cluster analysis, etc.
Exposure to data pipelines for both model training, evaluation and reporting/analytical purposes.
Use of cloud infrastructure to deploy model to a production environment would be beneficial.
Experience of using SQL to extract data from source systems.
Interest in data visualization tools, such as PowerBi, for model performance monitoring is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, including the confidence to present to key stakeholders.
Excellent written & oral communication skills, with an ability to interact with all levels of end users and technical resources.
Strong attention to detail and proactive in identifying and owning issues as they arise.Able to get up to speed quickly in understanding of the business metadata
To question the status quo and suggest possible improvements in the processes (harnessing automation where possible)







Our policy is to employ the best qualified people and provide equal opportunity for the advancement of employees including promotion and training and not to discriminate against any person because of gender, race, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion, belief or disability.







Thank you for your interest in working for us. Unfortunately, due to the volume of responses we cannot reply to every applicant, if you haven't heard from us in two weeks please assume you have not been successful.

Our policy is to employ the best qualified people and provide equal opportunity for the advancement of employees including promotion and training and not to discriminate against any person because of gender, race, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion, belief or disability.



Thank you for your interest in working for us. Unfortunately, due to the volume of responses we cannot reply to every applicant, if you haven't heard from us in two weeks please assume you have not been successful.

Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description:
Tadaweb is a pioneering technology company with roots in Luxembourg and a growing global presence, with offices in the United Kingdom, France, and the United States. For over 13 years, we’ve been on a mission to make the world a safer place by empowering analysts with the tools they need to access the right information at the right time. Our cutting-edge SaaS platform revolutionizes PAI and OSINT investigations, making them faster, smarter, and more effective, all while adhering to the highest ethical standards by relying solely on publicly available information and supporting our clients’ policies. Renowned for our “nothing is impossible” ethos, we prioritize trust, transparency, and innovation in everything we do.




We are looking for a skilled Data Scientist to help us unlock the power of our data and take our platform into the future. As part of our team, you will play a key role in analyzing our data and designing models that enhance our AI-powered analytics capabilities. You'll work alongside our skilled team of engineers and machine learning experts, directly contributing to next-generation capabilities that enable our users to automate their PAI collection and analysis workflows. This role is crucial to our mission of making the world safer by empowering the human mind with the right information at the right time.




Scope of Work:

Design and improve NLP models for text analysis, entity recognition, and relationship extraction from web content
Analyze data to identify patterns and insights that can enhance our platform's capabilities
Research and evaluate algorithms for information discovery from publicly available sources
Design advanced search and recommendation capabilities
Create and refine machine learning models for risk identification and pattern detection
Collaborate with engineers to integrate your data science solutions into our platform
Design and analyze A/B tests to measure the effectiveness of new features and models
Develop data visualization dashboards to communicate insights to users and stakeholders
Apply responsible AI practices in all aspects of model development
Analyze model performance, diagnose issues, and recommend improvements
Research and evaluate emerging technologies in NLP, information retrieval, and ML
Document methodologies, model architectures, and experimental results
Mentor junior team members and contribute to the data science community of practice




Your Profile:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related fields (PhD a plus)
Strong programming skills in Python, with proficiency in data science libraries (NumPy, Pandas, scikit-learn)
Experience with SQL for data querying and analysis
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms, statistical methods, and predictive modeling
Experience with NLP techniques for text analysis, classification, and information extraction
Knowledge of deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow
Experience with data visualization tools (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly, or similar)
Strong analytical mindset with a focus on solving real-world problems
Excellent communication skills to present findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Fluent in English




You get bonus points if you have any of the following:

Experience with large language models and generative AI technologies
Background in information retrieval systems or search engine development
Experience with OSINT or intelligence analysis tools and methodologies
Understanding of data privacy regulations and security considerations
Experience with time series analysis and anomaly detection
Familiarity with A/B testing and experimentation design
Experience working with PAI sources and analytical techniques
Knowledge of graph databases and network analysis for relationship mapping
Open-source contributions or research publications in relevant fields
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) for ML model deployment
Knowledge of MLOps practices and tools for experiment tracking
Experience with big data processing frameworks like Apache Spark
Knowledge of NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Elasticsearch) for handling unstructured data
Experience with data versioning and feature stores for machine learning
Proficiency in model deployment using containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)




What we offer:

The opportunity to join a growing tech company, with strong product-market fit and an ambitious roadmap
The chance to join a human-focused company that genuinely cares about its employees and core values and with an international exposure with our global team across Luxembourg, Paris, London, and Washington DC
A focus on performance of the team, not hours at the desk.
A social calendar including family parties, games nights, annual offsites, End of the year events and more, with an inclusive approach for both younger professionals and parents.




Tadaweb is an equal opportunity employer and we strive to have a team with diverse perspectives, experiences and backgrounds.




Our culture:

Our company culture is driven by the core values of family first, nothing is impossible and work hard, play harder.
We provide a healthy and positive culture that cares about employee wellbeing by creating a great workplace and investing our employees learning and development.
Our leaders aspire to the philosophies of extreme ownership, and servant leadership.

Title: Junior Data Scientist (f/m/d)
Description:
Company Description

We are seeking a technically skilled and passionate Junior Data Scientist to join our international and dynamic Data Science department at AUTO1 Group Technology. AUTO1 Group is Europe's leading digital automotive platform. We revolutionise the used car market with our well-known brands Autohero, wirkaufendeinauto.de, and AUTO1.com. Our team is divided accordingly based on the 3 brands and here at Auto1.com we focus on the sale to professional dealers. We are dedicated to leverage curing-edge technology to develop Machine learning solutions that optimize our Auto1.com sales and processes.

As a Junior data scientist, you will take part in developing innovative machine learning models that address a variety of challenges such as dynamic pricing based on market demands on Auto1.com platform, creating personalized recommendations for dealers, optimizing sales representatives calling priorities and forecasting demands on Auto1.com platform to make purchasing pricing decisions. We also tackle technical implementation such as feature stores as internal support for the entire data science department. We are excited to work with talented contributors. Join us in shaping the future of automotive dealer sales with machine learning solutions!

Job Description


Assist in translating business needs into data science questions and contribute to the research and development of Machine Learning solutions that bring positive business impact
Work collaboratively with engineering and product teams to support the deployment of data science solutions and their integration into the Auto1 technology infrastructure.
Monitor the performance of models in production, prepare reports for stakeholders and assist in developing actionable next steps under guidance.
Learn from senior team members, follow best practices and actively contribute to achieving project goals as part of a collaborative team


Qualifications


A university degree in STEM fields or a prior work experience in data analytics and data science
Knowledge in machine learning algorithms on supervised and unsupervised learning
Demonstration of hands-on experience with SQL and Python for data manipulation, analysis, and modeling.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud and experience in Github or Git is a plus.
Ability to draw conclusions from data and recommend actions.
Strong communication and visualisation skills to effectively present findings in a clear and concise manner.


Additional Information


Working from home: you can work from home up to 5 days a week
International team with flat hierarchies and open communication
Educational budget to support your continuous learning and development
Regular knowledge sharing session within team on various topics
Exciting team events every quarter
Discounts at Autohero, our platform for high-quality used cars


Contact

Marija Dimitrova

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Title: Data Scientist - Internship
Description:
Company Description

Life at Grab

At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia.

Job Description

Get to know the team

The Data Science (Geo Vision) team focuses on improving maps and building map-based localization, routing, travel time estimation, and traffic forecasting. These efforts support multiple Grab services. We use Computer Vision, NLP, Information Retrieval, Text Mining, and conventional machine learning techniques to process a variety of signals such as images, videos, text, sensor readings, and GPS probes to understand locations and road networks.

Get to know the role

We are looking for an intern data scientist to help automate the map creation using data science techniques. We believe you have at least basic modern vision skills and deep learning knowledge. You will work on site at the Cluj Office and report to the Head of Data Science based in Cluj-Napoca.

The Critical Tasks You Will Perform


You will develop architectures to address the new demands of computer vision and machine learning algorithms applied in the map-making process.
You will collaborate across DS teams


Qualifications

What Essential Skills You Need


Familiarity with Python and some of the following libraries: PyTorch, Tensorflow or Fast.ai; NumPy; OpenCV; scikit-learn;
Understanding of machine learning methods for classification, regression, and clustering.
Learner who keeps updated with the current state of computer vision and deep learning techniques/architectures.
Proficient in English


Learning Goals


An understanding of Deep Learning, in particular with design, training, evaluation, and optimization of convolutional neural net (CNN) architectures in the context of at least one of the following: object detection, segmentation, scene classification, object tracking, OCR.
Familiarity with Azure cloud platform for deploying or maintaining ML systems


Additional Information

Our Commitment

We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workplace that enables all Grabbers to perform at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity sexual orientation, and other attributes that make each Grabber unique.

Benefits At Grab


Insurance: Comprehensive Term Life Insurance and Medical Insurance.
Customized Benefits: GrabFlex offers a tailored benefits package.
Parental Leave: Maternity and Paternity Leave for new parents.
Support Programs: Confidential Grabber Assistance Programme for life's challenges.
Well-being Programs: Access to Wellbeing@Grab, including health programs, webinars, and events.
Work-Life Balance: FlexWork arrangements to support personal and professional life.
Show more

Title: Biological Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Syngenta Group, a global leader in agricultural technology and innovation, employs 60,000 people across more than 100 countries to transform agriculture through tailor-made solutions for farmers, society, and our planet. Our diverse portfolio encompasses seeds, crop protection, nutrition products, agronomic solutions, and digital services, all designed to help farmers produce healthy food, feed, fiber, and fuel while conserving natural resources and protecting the environment. Our mission is to address critical challenges such as climate change and food security through sustainable practices and cutting-edge solutions, while safeguarding the planet's resources.

Syngenta Seeds, a leading developer and producer of Field Crops, Vegetable, and Flower Seeds, is part of Syngenta Group. We bring farmers more vigorous, stronger, resistant plants, including innovative hybrid varieties and biotech crops.

Job Description


Type: Permanent
Business Unit: P&S – Vegetable Seed Enhancement Technology
Location: NL-Enkhuizen 


Responsibilities

The Vegetable Seed Enhancement Team (VSET) is closely connected to the vegetable seeds R&D, production and processing plants and services all Syngenta vegetable sites globally. We have an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated Biological Data Scientist to join us and be a member of a multidisciplinary team embedded with a variety of stakeholders to support the global vegetable seeds business. You will focus on designing and implementing imaging technologies, algorithms, and building artificial intelligence systems to automate measurements and understanding of seeds and plants. Key responsibilities will include:


Translating the imaging and AI systems to commercial scales that could be used across vegetable seed processing plants.
Designing and implementing automated seed processing systems using image-based methods and artificial intelligence.
Applying AI and machine learning techniques to study and analyse seed phenotypes and seedling characteristics.
Processing and interpreting large datasets to identify trends in seed quality and translating the findings to practical solutions to improve seed quality.
Collaborating with interdisciplinary teams to drive innovation in seed science and practical solutions beneficial to the global Syngenta VEG business.


Qualifications


Ph.D. or MSc degree with proven experience in machine learning and artificial intelligence or equivalent qualifications.
Strong knowledge of image analysis, machine learning, and seed physiology; or willingness to learn and establish strong knowledge of seed physiology and business.
Strong project management skills with the ability to lead projects in a corporate environment.
Ability to convey complex technical concepts to diverse audiences, while influencing and persuading key stakeholders.
Demonstrated ability to make data-driven decisions, while valuing and incorporating expert inputs when needed.
English language proficiency at minimum B2 level (Common European Framework scale) and willingness to learn Dutch.
Enjoys working in a highly diverse corporate environment with focus on innovation and customer centricity.


Additional Information

Take your chance!

At Syngenta, we believe in creating an inclusive and diverse work environment where all employees are valued and given the opportunity to grow. We offer a competitive salary and a comprehensive package of secondary employment benefits.

Are you excited to strengthen our team? Don't miss this great opportunity! Apply online today at www.syngenta.com. For questions, please contact our recruiter Nienke Terluin at Nienke.terluin@syngenta.com.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🚀 Join Movify – Where elevation starts with a vision!




At Movify, we don’t just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of digital experiences?




About the job




🤠 What you'll be doing

Design and implement machine learning models to solve complex business problems
Develop data pipelines and workflows for large-scale data processing
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns and insights
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business challenges and define data science objectives
Create and maintain predictive models, optimization algorithms, and statistical analyses
Communicate findings and recommendations through compelling visualizations and reports
Stay current with advancements in machine learning and data science methodologies
Test, validate, and fine-tune models for accuracy and scalability
Work closely with data engineers to ensure data integrity and availability
Contribute to the development of the company’s data strategy and best practices




🤓 Skills & qualifications

3+ years of experience in a data science or related role
Proficiency in Python or R, with a strong understanding of data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large datasets
Solid understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and probability
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control systems (e.g., Git)
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
A proactive and innovative mindset with attention to detail
Fluent in French or Dutch with good command of English
A passion for turning data into actionable insights




😍 Movify offers

Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology and business
Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
Regular team-building activities and celebrations to keep the energy high

Title: Junior Data Scientist with English (Recent graduate)
Description:
Are you a recent graduate, passionate about challenges, and excited about working with cutting-edge technologies?




Are you motivated by transforming data into strategic knowledge and generating real impact?

Would you like to be part of a dynamic, international environment full of opportunities?




Our client, a fast-growing technology startup, is on a mission to accelerate the global success of mobile applications. Backed by a strong client portfolio of top-tier developers and publishers, the company operates from three strategic hubs: Spain, Poland, and the United States. As they continue to scale, they are now expanding their team in Barcelona and seeking motivated recent graduates eager to kick-start their careers and contribute to an ambitious, high-impact project.




Join a vibrant Data Tech-Hub where you can grow and learn from a passionate team of Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and ML/Data Engineers is ready to innovate and inspire!




Main Responsabilities:

Assist in analyzing data to identify trends, patterns, and contribute to actionable insights under the guidance of senior team members.
Participate in the design and development of data science solutions
Contribute to various stages from initial analysis and model development to deployment, with a focus on optimizing for performance and scalability within ad targeting, bid strategies, and campaign performance analysis.
Collaborate with technical and business teams to understand requirements and contribute to data-driven solutions and insights, particularly focusing on enhancing advertising effectiveness and ROI, while learning from experienced colleagues.
Assist in maintaining and optimizing existing data processing pipelines and machine learning models, with a focus on applications within the ad-tech ecosystem
Contribute to the exploration and evaluation of new data science techniques and technologies relevant to AdTech.




Core Skills/Experience:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to learn how to derive insights from datasets.
Solid understanding of statistical modeling and machine learning fundamentals.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.

Tech Stack (Exposure and Willingness to Learn):

Proficient in Python and SQL.
Familiarity with data manipulation frameworks such as Pandas.
Exposure to big data processing concepts (e.g., PySpark) is a plus.
Basic understanding of ETL processes and tools (e.g., concepts similar to Dagster).
Basic understanding of OLAP database concepts (e.g., concepts similar to Druid).
Familiarity with cloud services (e.g., AWS) at a conceptual level.
Exposure to DNN model training libraries and frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hydra, Comet) through coursework or projects.
Knowledge of Databricks (even through academic projects) is a plus.




What's on offer:

Competitive salary
Permanent Contract
Comprehensive benefits package
Opportunities for professional development and growth
Flexible work hours and vacation policy
Great opportunity to kick-start your career in Data Science




Our recruitment process:

Step 1: Interview with our Recruiter to get to know you
Step 2: Interview with our client's HR Team
Step 3: Technical interview
Step 4: Interview with Hiring Manager

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Our client offers AI-powered SaaS solutions to optimize electricity sales and efficiently manage renewable portfolios. Their innovative software empowers green energy players to automate power trading decisions, enabling them to become active market participants and maximize returns while managing risk efficiently.

The company has been founded on the belief that a green energy economy can be both sustainable and competitive and they are driven to make a change in the sector by accelerating technology.

They are active across Europe and is partnering with Europe’s leading energy service companies, independent renewable energy producers and large industries, among others.

Recently they closed their latest investment round with Encavis AG, one of the leading independent power producers (IPP), listed on the MDAX of Deutsche Börse AG. That strategic investment will open new opportunities for them by giving an exposure to pan-European platforms, industry expertise and access to new markets.

They are currently scaling their research and development team specializing in developing innovative solutions to complex problems using cutting-edge technology and advanced scientific knowledge.

Your Role and Responsibilities:

They are looking for an ambitious Data Scientist who is passionate about building data-driven products intended to support integration of renewable energy.

You will be responsible for improving advanced data science and machine learning solutions to optimize trading of renewable energy on various markets.




Develop and implement advanced machine learning models and algorithms, including XGBoost, CatBoost, LightGBM, and deep neural networks, specifically for tabular data
Analyze complex datasets to identify patterns, trends, and insights
Collaborate with product, engineering, and business teams to understand objectives and deliver data-driven solutions
Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in data science and machine learning, especially techniques related to tabular data
Contribute to the development and optimization of our data processing and modeling pipelines




​What would make you a strong fit:

Relevant experience working on data science projects
Familiarity in programming languages such as Python
Competence in supervised and unsupervised learning techniques for tabular data
Experience with advanced algorithms like XGBoost, CatBoost, LightGBM, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and deep neural networks
Understanding of model evaluation, validation, and optimization techniques
Experience deploying machine learning models on cloud platforms and familiarity with cloud-based services for data processing and model deployment such as AWS will be considered as an advantage
Step beyond traditional roles to lead initiatives and introduce improvements
Experience working in team environment
Excellent communication skills in English, both verbal and in writing

​

For more details, let's talk at martin@cadabra.bg

(License No. 2709 from 17.01.2019)

Show more
